xe.gloss: a colorless odorless inert gaseous element occurring in the earth's atmosphere in trace amounts

xenicidae.gloss: alternative names for the family comprising the New Zealand wrens

xenogenesis.gloss: the alternation of two or more different forms in the life cycle of a plant or animal

xenograft.gloss: tissue from an animal of one species used as a temporary graft (as in cases of severe burns) on an individual of another species

xenon.gloss: a colorless odorless inert gaseous element occurring in the earth's atmosphere in trace amounts

xenopodidae.gloss: in some classifications the family of the genus Xenopus which is otherwise included in the family Pipidae

xenopus laevis.gloss: a tongueless frog native to Africa

xenosaurus.gloss: type and sole genus of Xenosauridae: slender-bodied Mexican lizards having the upper surface covered with tiny granules and tubercles

xenotransplant.gloss: a surgical procedure in which tissue or whole organs are transfered from one species to another species

xenotransplantation.gloss: a surgical procedure in which tissue or whole organs are transfered from one species to another species

xeranthemum annuum.gloss: mostly widely cultivated species of everlasting flowers having usually purple flowers

xerobates.gloss: possible new genus for desert and Texas tortoises based on recent research

xeroderma.gloss: a mild form of ichthyosis characterized by abnormal dryness and roughness of the skin

xerodermia.gloss: a mild form of ichthyosis characterized by abnormal dryness and roughness of the skin

xerographic copier.gloss: a duplicator (trade mark Xerox) that copies graphic matter by the action of light on an electrically charged photoconductive insulating surface in which the latent image is developed with a resinous powder

xeroma.gloss: abnormal dryness of the conjunctiva and cornea of the eyes

xerophile.gloss: plant adapted for life with a limited supply of water

xerophilous plant.gloss: plant adapted for life with a limited supply of water

xerophthalmia.gloss: abnormal dryness of the conjunctiva and cornea of the eyes

xerophthalmus.gloss: abnormal dryness of the conjunctiva and cornea of the eyes

xerophyllum.gloss: small genus of North American herbs having grasslike basal leaves: squaw grass

xerophyllum tenax.gloss: plant of western North America having woody rhizomes and tufts of stiff grasslike basal leaves and spikes of creamy white flowers

xerophyte.gloss: plant adapted for life with a limited supply of water

xerophytic plant.gloss: plant adapted for life with a limited supply of water

xerostomia.gloss: abnormal dryness of the mouth resulting from decreased secretion of saliva

xerotes.gloss: the condition of not containing or being covered by a liquid (especially water)

xerox copy.gloss: a copy made by a xerographic copier

xerox machine.gloss: a duplicator (trade mark Xerox) that copies graphic matter by the action of light on an electrically charged photoconductive insulating surface in which the latent image is developed with a resinous powder

xerxes i.gloss: king of Persia who led a vast army against Greece and won the battle of Thermopylae but was eventually defeated (519-465 BC)

xerxes the great.gloss: king of Persia who led a vast army against Greece and won the battle of Thermopylae but was eventually defeated (519-465 BC)

xestobium rufovillosum.gloss: bores through wood making a ticking sound popularly thought to presage death
